snippet: The Office of Civil Rights found that the university, which is already enacting reforms, failed to respond quickly and fairly to students’ complaints.
abstract: Federal investigation into Princeton University's sexual misconduct and discrimination policies finds that school has not met the standards set forth in Title IX; Education Department's Office of Civil Rights reports that university failed to provide prompt and fair response to allegations of sexual misconduct.
lead_paragraph: The Office of Civil Rights found that the university, which is already enacting reforms, failed to respond quickly and fairly to students’ complaints.

headline.main: Princeton Mishandled Sexual Misconduct and Discrimination Cases, U.S. Inquiry Finds
headline.print_headline: Federal Inquiry Cites Princeton for Poor Action on Complaints
